meanings.definition: To cut short or reduce in quantity
meanings.sent1: I had to curtail my vacation due to unexpected work commitments.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to curtail its expenses to improve profitability.
meanings.sent3: Trying to curtail my chocolate intake is a real challenge.
meanings.sent4: The storm curtailed our outdoor plans with its heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher curtailed the lesson to ensure everyone understood the key points.

meanings.sent1: The new rules curtail the use of electronic devices in the library.
meanings.sent2: The government may curtail certain freedoms in times of emergency.
meanings.sent3: I curtailed my dog's access to the garden to protect the flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure curtailed her willingness to take risks.
meanings.sent5: The fence curtailed the movement of the livestock within the pasture.

meanings.sent1: The illness curtailed him of his strength and energy.
meanings.sent2: The court order could curtail his right to see his children.
meanings.sent3: Being on a diet curtailed me of my favorite desserts.
meanings.sent4: The injury curtailed his ability to participate in the race.
meanings.sent5: The blackout curtailed the town of electricity for hours.
